meanings.definition: To cause to be separate or apart
meanings.sent2: The river disunites the two towns.
meanings.sent3: The stubbornness of the siblings disunites them over trivial matters.
meanings.sent4: Miscommunication often disunites even the closest of relationships.
meanings.sent5: The high wall disunites the garden from the rest of the yard.

meanings.definition: To break up or dissolve a union or relationship
meanings.sent2: The war disunites the once peaceful nations.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick disunites the linked rings in a surprising way.
meanings.sent4: Betrayal can disunite even the strongest of alliances.
meanings.sent5: The storm's fury disunites the fragile sandcastle on the beach.
